thread.title: Is sharemarket volatility for the past month normal? No
thread.title_full: Is sharemarket volatility for the past month normal? No | afr.com

author: Jeremy Chunn
title: Is sharemarket volatility for the past month normal? No
text:
Investors have witnessed a lot of vitriol in the markets lately, but how much is noise and how much is something worse. Bruce Mercer by Jeremy Chunn The chart here shows the frequency of daily returns for the S&P/ASX 200 for the past 12 months, divided into brackets of 0.2 per cent.
The data is bunched together in a symmetrical hump that tapers away on either side, similar to the "bell" shape of the normal distribution familiar to high school students.
The short red boxes along the bottom are the daily data for the past 26 trading days.
The flat distribution is ominous. Note that both extreme end points occurred in the past month.
AFR Graphic For the past year, the index has lost an average 0.021 per cent a day. For the past month, it's lost an average 0.218 per cent a day.
The variance in returns, or standard deviation, has also increased dramatically. For the past year, it's been 0.986 per cent; for the past month, it's been 1.635 per cent.
Yes, the market is more volatile than is usual.
It's not twice as volatile, but it's not far off.
